direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve updating the value associated with a key, but 'put' also checks the key for validity.
Both methods modify the state of the map, but 'remove' deletes a key-value pair while 'put' updates or adds one.
Both methods involve adding or updating key-value pairs in the map, but 'putAll' does so for multiple entries at once.
Both methods interact with the map's key-value pairs, but 'get' retrieves a value while 'put' updates or adds one.
Both methods depend on the presence of a key in the map, but 'containsKey' only checks for its existence while 'put' modifies the map.
Both methods involve adding or updating key-value pairs in a map, but the external method has a more complex implementation with resizing and rehashing.
